instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to estimate plant nitrogen content (PNC) in different growth periods of potato crops?
Output: In the related research, the researchers used visible remote sensing spectrum to estimate plant nitrogen content (PNC) in different growth periods of potato crops.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to estimate plant nitrogen content (PNC) in different growth periods of potato crops?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used to estimate plant nitrogen content (PNC) in different growth periods of potato cropsI were vegetation indices (VIs) and two-dimensional discrete wavelet decomposition technology (DWT).

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the PNC estimation model and how far can this metric go in terms of accuracy and stability in the related research on estimating plant nitrogen content (PNC) using vegetation indices (VIs) combined with two-dimensional discrete wavelet decomposition technology (DWT) to extract high-frequency information (HFI) at multiple scales?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the PNC estimation model was the coefficient of determination (R-2) and RMSE. The R-2 values for the five growth periods of potato were 0.833, 0.764, 0.791, 0.664, and 0.435, respectively. 

In terms of accuracy and stability, the R-2 values indicate the proportion of the variance in the PNC data that can be explained by the model. A higher R-2 value indicates a better fit of the model to the data. The best result of RMSE can reach 0.2866%

instruction: What machine learning models were used to construct and evaluate the PNC estimation models for each growth period using VIs, HFI principal components, and VIs HFI principal components as model variables in the related research on estimating plant nitrogen content (PNC) using vegetation indices (VIs) combined with two-dimensional discrete wavelet decomposition technology (DWT) to extract high-frequency information (HFI) at multiple scales?
Output: The machine learning models used to construct and evaluate the PNC estimation models for each growth period in the related research were ridge regression and extreme learning machine (ELM).

instruction: Can the combination of vegetation indices (VIs) and high-frequency information (HFI) be considered as a superior spectroscopic method for estimating plant nitrogen content (PNC) in different growth periods of potato crops, based on the results of the research?
Output: Yes, based on the results of the research, the combination of vegetation indices (VIs) and high-frequency information (HFI) can be considered as a superior spectroscopic method for estimating plant nitrogen content (PNC) in different growth periods of potato crops. The research showed that the accuracy and stability of the PNC estimation model constructed with VIs+HFI as model variables were higher than that of a single VIs and HFI. Additionally, the modeling R-2 values and RMSE values for each growth period indicated that the PNC estimation model using VIs+HFI had a better effect compared to other methods. Therefore, the combination of VIs and HFI can provide new technical support for real-time and efficient potato nitrogen nutrition status detection.
